thread.title: Badgers football: Tom Oates grades UW's performance vs. Nebraska
thread.title_full: Badgers football: Tom Oates grades UW's performance vs. Nebraska

author: TOM OATES | Wisconsin State Journal | toates@madison.com | 608-252-6172
title: Badgers football: Tom Oates grades UW's performance vs. Nebraska
text:
Buy Now FRANCIS GARDLER — Lincoln Journal Star 
Wisconsin running back Dare Ogunbowale steps away from Nebraska linebacker Chris Weber in the fourth quarter of the Badgers' 23-21 victory on Saturday at Memorial Stadium in Lincoln, Neb. Ogunbowale rushed for 83 of his 117 yards in the final 15 minutes. Offense • C+ 
The receivers rebounded from some early drops with big catches in the second half. Nice to have Alex Erickson back, isn't it? The running game went nowhere until the end, when Dare Ogunbowale showed up in a big way. You've got to hand it to Joel Stave — nothing gets him down. Defense • B 
Except for a brief lapse late in the first half and one play in the fourth quarter, the defense was stellar. UW stresses limiting big plays, but two long touchdowns accounted for almost a third of Nebraska's yards. When the defense needed a stop at the end, it got it. Special teams • C+ 
Rafael Gaglianone's late missed field goal was deflating, but he made up for it with his game-winner. Punter Drew Meyer had great hang time but needed line drives into the wind. When he did, he pinned Nebraska at the 1. Andrew Endicott's out-of-bounds kickoff was a buzzkill. Coaching • B 
Paul Chryst's confidence in Gaglianone never wavered and it paid off in the end. The run was going nowhere but Chryst stayed with it and UW wore down Nebraska in the fourth quarter. The Badgers should have been spying Tommy Armstrong when he converted a third-and-15 late. Overall • B 
It wasn't always pretty — actually, it was pretty frustrating for three quarters — but UW never gave in. The Badgers had a huge fourth quarter to come out on top in a must-win Big Ten game at an intimidating stadium. Not everything is clicking, but this team has character. 
Contact Tom Oates at toates@madison.com or 608-252-6172. Tom Oates 
Tom Oates has been a staff member of the Wisconsin State Journal sports department for 30 years and its editorial voice for more than 15, traversing the state and country to bring readers a Madison perspective on the biggest sports stories of the day -- from UW athletics to the Green Bay Packers, Milwaukee Brewers and Bucks, as well as local teams such as the Mallards and Mustangs.
